ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Optical Mesosphere Thermosphere Imagers (OMTI) Fabry-Perot Interferometer at Chiang Mai, Thailand
ResourceHeader.Description: Fabry-Perot Interferometer (FPI) settled at Chiang Mai, Thailand, which is a part of the Optical Mesosphere Thermosphere Imagers (OMTIs). The FPI measures thermospheric neutral wind through the airglow emissions at a wavelengths of 630.0 nm. Details are described by Shiokawa et al. (2012) which are available at http://stdb2.isee.nagoya-u.ac.jp/omti/paper/paper.html. The OMTIs were developed at the Institute for Space-Earth Environmental Research, Nagoya University, in order to investigate the dynamics of the upper atmosphere through nocturnal airglow emissions.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please contact the principal investigator (PI) of the OMTIs, Prof. K. Shiokawa (shiokawa at isee.nagoya-u.ac.jp) before using the data.
